result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Zimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $4,000 is to be paid joint/several with the co-actor.  To be paid to the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint as a Condition of Probation BEFORE costs/fines (may be taken out prison wages/trust accounts).

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation (may be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim or his business or co-actor listed in the criminal complaint.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions, commencing forthwith.
LAST 6 MONTHS - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Benjamin J Zimmer in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.
Defendant prepared a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 8 Years.
Initial Confinement: 4 Years.
Extended Supervision: 4 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  5 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim or his business or co-actor listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


RESTITUTION:  $40,000 Joint/Several with Co-Actor (to be paid to victim (C.S.) listed in the complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Sentence (would include prison wages/trust accounts).


CONDITION TIME: 
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant remanded to the Custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department - FORTHWITH.
Last 6 Months - STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Benjamin J Zimmer in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.   

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Matter put over for Sentencing (to allow for the victim to be present).
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Benjamin J Zimmer in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant to have no contact with  co defendant, victim/witness/business (Auto Road Track and Trailer) listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Benjamin J Zimmer in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
